holidays.name: Singles Awareness Day
holidays.description: A humorous day for single people to celebrate themselves and poke fun at the commercialism of Valentine's Day. It's a lighthearted way to embrace singlehood and maybe indulge in some self-care or fun antics.
holidays.origin: Originating as an ironic counterpart to Valentine's Day, Singles Awareness Day gained popularity with college students and singles communities as a tongue-in-cheek observance.
holidays.funFact: Some singles celebrate by exchanging cheeky 'anti-Valentine' cards or hosting parties where the only rule is: no couple talk allowed!

holidays.name: National Gumdrop Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration dedicated to the colorful, chewy gumdrop candy‚Äîperfect for brightening winter days with sugary delight!
holidays.origin: Established in the mid-20th century when candy companies promoted fun food holidays to boost sales during the winter slump.
holidays.funFact: Gumdrops became wildly popular after the Great Chicago Fire of 1871 because candy makers supplied gumdrops as treats during the city's rebuilding period!

holidays.name: WAFFLE FRIDAY (European Promotion)
holidays.description: While not widely celebrated worldwide, some European countries consider the Friday nearest to February 15 a day to celebrate waffles, much like Belgium's love for this delicious treat.
holidays.origin: Began as a marketing campaign by waffle companies in Europe to boost mid-winter sales and share waffle recipes.
holidays.funFact: Most European waffle celebrations include competitions to make the craziest waffle topping combinations‚Äîthink waffles topped with cheese, meats, or even ice cream!

holidays.name: Susan B. Anthony Day
holidays.description: Honors the birthday of Susan B. Anthony, a pivotal leader for women's suffrage and rights in the United States. A day to remember the fight for equality.
holidays.origin: Officially recognized in some U.S. states since 1985 to commemorate Anthony's impact on women's rights and voting laws.
holidays.funFact: Susan B. Anthony was arrested in 1872 for voting illegally in the presidential election‚Äîshe refused to pay the fine as a protest!
